intro: Myosotis arvensis var. grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, sky-blue flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shady habitats such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, while its stems are slender and often hairy. The flowers are clustered in loose racemes and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
